intro: Templetonia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed templetonia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Templetonia stenophylla plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
